subject: Climate & Environment
title: The Anatomy of a Wildfire
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: The Anatomy of a Wildfire.

hook.text: A wildfire needs three things: heat, fuel, and oxygen. Remove one and the fire dies.

buildup.text: Dry vegetation acts as fuel. A single lightning strike or discarded cigarette can ignite it.

discovery.text: Wind feeds oxygen to the flames and carries embers kilometers ahead, starting new fires.

twist.text: Crown fires leap from treetop to treetop at speeds that outrun firefighters on foot.

climax.text: Large fires create their own weather â€” generating thunderstorms and fire tornadoes.

punchline.text: A wildfire doesn't just burn in the weather. It becomes the weather.

quiz.question: What three elements does a wildfire need to burn?
